content: Hey @WG-async-foundations time for the weekly triage meeting!
eholk is on PTO today, so I'm filling in

We have the usual agenda today:

  • announcements
  • issue triage [yosh]
  • discussion on progress blockers on sprint bugs
(also, there's a cat deciding it's time for pats right now, so typing is taking some effort)
Starting off: does anyone have any announcements?
I'm publishing a blog post with a summary of the proposed syntaxes so far and the rationale behind them this week.
For generators
Very cool; looking forward to reading it!
If nobody has anything else to announce, let's move on to the next topic?
@triagebot end-topic
Unknown Zulip user. Please add zulip-id = 211722 to your file in rust-lang/team.
well, lol
well, I guess we can do without triage bot this meeting
alright, moving on!
I have a few minor things
(sorry, running a bit slow)
(a) after some discussion we've got some planned changes about RPITIT, async fn in traits, etc

(b) we had our first "async fundamentsl" stakeholder meeting (@Yoshua Wuyts [he/they] was there :) and I hope that this week we can prepare a "summary" of what was dioscussed and publish it, but the content we reviewed is all published already on https://rust-lang.github.io/async-fundamentals-initiative/

nikomatsakis said:

(a) after some discussion we've got some planned changes about RPITIT, async fn in traits, etc

they're covered more-or-less on that repo too
but also
(c) I promised long ago to get t-shirts made for folks who helped with the async vision doc
and totally dropped the ball
I want to pick it back up!
I have a t-shirt design now
I deluded myself into thinking I could get a lot done while buying a house and starting a new job so I am going to doing very little for a few weeks more, I'm sorry
I'm going to publish a google form for people who want one and who "self identify" as having helped with the project; I'll chck the list against the known contributors and look for any discrepancies
https://rust-lang.github.io/wg-async-foundations/acknowledgments.html
if your name is not on there, but you feel you contributed, please reach out! more likely the page is out of date
I'm working on a blog post to introduce the concept of "with clauses" for passing around context
ooh, nice

I was thinking of working on a post around the latest updates for "impl trait in traits" that I was discussing above; I'll avoid going into more details here since it's too complex to cover without taking over the meeting
ok, I'm done @Yoshua Wuyts [he/they] :)
sounds like a lot of really cool updates; thanks all!
Okay, moving on to: new issue triage
We have two new issues this week
Starting with #90937: must_not_suspend should trigger for temporary in match expression (but does not)
we can cc #83310 on this
The analysis here in regards to expressions is a bit iffy, and it may be missing temporaries entirely, but I think eholks changes should be the route the fix this
does indeed look like a bug
doesn't necessarily need to block stabilizing the feature since it's a false negative, but it would really be nice to fix
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/91032 might fix it, we would add a test
(The motivating example in this PR, using drop, probably should block stabilization)
I can leave a comment summarizing the discussion here, if someone isn't already working on it
also I don't think this needs to be marked "on deck", linking to it from the tracking issue should be enough

tmandry said:

I can leave a comment summarizing the discussion here, if someone isn't already working on it

done
alright, sounds like we're ready to move on to the next issue!
Next up: Feature: Provide getters of data and vtable pointer for RawWaker? #87021
I guess they're asking a good question; what are the stability guarantees for the layout of RawWaker?
I wonder if this needs a libs RFC
seems like a lighter weight process might suffice, but I'm not sure if there is one
libs team actually does have a lighter weight process
they don't usually go in for RFCs
not sure if/where that's documented :)
ah okay :)
well I don't have a strong opinion about this, seems like we could do it
the tl;dr being "open a PR and do an FCP to create tracking issue, unstable feature" (or something like that)
agreed
I guess we could just post a general "+1 from async wg" and cc libs team for next steps
I'm not sure that I would want to make guarantees about the layout of rawwaker etc
though I'm not neecessarily opposed
but I doubt we could add new fields or things without breakage anyhow
I believe we intended for Context to be extensible, because once we stabilized Waker / RawWaker we couldn't extend those?
heh, we're just about on time
What do we think we should recommend for the issue?

I guess we could just post a general "+1 from async wg" and cc libs team for next steps

agree with this
I can write that comment if nobody else is writing it
We didn't get to discussing the sprint bugs, but we can make sure to cover that next week
We're a bit over time; so I say we call it here
Thanks everyone!
Thanks @Yoshua Wuyts [he/they] for leading the meeting!
